climbs.name: Just A Little Lunch Break
climbs.fa: Gene Larson and Paul Muehl    August 11 1991

content.description: Starts up the face passing two newer bolts. You will come to the small bulge that has a Pin in the seam. Pull the bulge and move up onto the upper face for a couple more bolts.
content.protection: 6? Quickdraws small gear to back up pins and Rps up top
content.location: This climb is on the SW face. It is actually on a sub formation of Pilgrams Progress mass. If you park at the pull off hike the trail that leaves the parking lot on the west end. You will skirt the west side of the Pilgrams Progress Mass. Once the trail drops down you if you look directly in front of you this climb is on this face. Nice belay area and kind of a forgotten climb.

content.description: Pilgrims progress  is a formation on the second turn about after exiting the Needles eye tunnel. A few routes are found here. Easy climbing for most of it with a few harder lines. Great views of Custer and the surrounding area. The valleys drop on both sides making you feel higher than you really are.
